title: Researchers teach an AI to write better chart captions
summary: MIT researchers have developed a dataset called VisText to improve automatic chart captioning systems. The dataset contains over 12,000 charts represented as data tables, images, and scene graphs, along with associated captions. Machine-learning models trained with VisText consistently generated precise and semantically rich captions that effectively described data trends and complex patterns. The researchers found that scene graphs were a useful representation for autocaptioning, and they also explored varying the complexity of the captions. The goal is to provide VisText as a tool for researchers to improve chart autocaptioning and enhance accessibility for people with visual disabilities.
